page.title: 07Public Transport
page.content: The main line of transport is the railway that goes west to Tattenham Corner near the Epsom race course and east to Purley, where it is possible to change to trains going to Victoria station in London. The two stations called Kingswood and Chipstead are used by young people quite frequently. Adults are struck by the beauty of the line which travels on an embankment in Chipstead Valley and plunges into a deep leafy cutting after it leaves Chipstead station.The crossing of Outwood Lane is made on a viaduct which dominates the landscape there. The most useful bus is the 166 which travels from S. of Woodmansterne to Croydon, which is a major shopping centre. Those who can reach Banstead may use the 164 to Sutton, those able to reach Coulsdon have the 405, 414 to Croydon.
